channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Floating Notification Bar, Sticky Menu on Scroll, Announcement Banner, and Sticky Header for Any Theme
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Floating Notification Bar, Sticky Menu on Scroll, Announcement Banner, and Sticky Header for Any Theme

item.title: CVE-2023-5509|2024-08-02T07:59:44.718Z -- unknown -- floating%20notification%20bar%2C%20sticky%20menu%20on%20scroll%2C%20announcement%20banner%2C%20and%20sticky%20header%20for%20any%20theme
item.description: The myStickymenu WordPress plugin before 2.6.5 does not adequately authorize some ajax calls, allowing any logged-in user to perform the actions.

item.title: CVE-2024-4090|2024-08-01T13:36:51.336Z -- unknown -- floating%20notification%20bar%2C%20sticky%20menu%20on%20scroll%2C%20announcement%20banner%2C%20and%20sticky%20header%20for%20any%20theme
item.description: The Floating Notification Bar, Sticky Menu on Scroll, Announcement Banner, and Sticky Header for Any WordPress plugin before 2.7.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2024-4090|2024-08-01T06:00:05.396Z -- unknown -- floating%20notification%20bar%2C%20sticky%20menu%20on%20scroll%2C%20announcement%20banner%2C%20and%20sticky%20header%20for%20any%20theme
item.description: The Floating Notification Bar, Sticky Menu on Scroll, Announcement Banner, and Sticky Header for Any WordPress plugin before 2.7.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed
